intro: Coccoloba belizensis, commonly known as the Belize lacrosse tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly Belize, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
